medical_history.chief_complaint: Eyelid basal cell carcinoma associated with Gorlin-Goltz syndrome.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The mean age at detection of the first basal cell carcinoma was 30 years (range, 16–38 years). All patients had multiple basal cell carcinomas, with eyelid basal cell carcinoma typically noted at a mean age of 60 years (range, 54–65 years). Local recurrence occurred in all patients after initial excisions.
medical_history.past_medical_history: All patients had a history of multiple basal cell carcinomas. One patient had experienced surgical complications from jaw cysts and opened-angle glaucoma.
medical_history.family_history: All four patients had a family history of Gorlin-Goltz syndrome.
